DOC.brief_title: Treating Major Depression With Yoga : A Prospective , Randomized Controlled Pilot Trial
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , single-center , single-blind , randomize , control , parallel group , pilot trial 8-week hatha yoga program mono-therapy major depression . Recruitment occur May October 2010 , trial conclude January 2011 . We recruit 38 adult San Francisco community meet criterion major depression mild-to-moderate severity , per screen diagnostic evaluation Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview ( MINI ) score 14 28 Beck Depression Inventory-II ( BDI ) . At screening , individual engage psychotherapy , antidepressant pharmacotherapy , herbal/nutraceutical mood remedy , mind-body practice exclude . Eligible participant randomize 1:1 ratio one two instructor-led intervention group : hatha yoga practice group assign 90-minute hatha yoga practice session twice weekly 8 week , versus attention control education group assign 90-minute yoga history seminar twice weekly 8 week . Participants hatha yoga group learn practice specific sequence classical yoga breathe technique , mindful body posture , final deep relaxation pose . The attention control education group explore history philosophy main branch yoga seminar feature lecture , documentary film , interactive dialogue instructor participant ; seminar design control non-specific mood benefit hatha yoga intervention , attention study personnel , peer interaction , time spend away routine activity , anticipation/interest relate master novel yoga-related information . Stratified block randomization undertaken ensure intervention group equal number participant mild depression ( per screen BDI score 14 19 ) versus moderate depression ( per screen BDI score 20 28 ) . Participants inform screen anyone randomized education group would offer 16 free hatha yoga class , upon completion study , learn practice exercise teach hatha yoga practice group . The primary outcome depression severity , measure BDI score 2-week interval intervention start 0 week intervention end 8 week . Secondary outcome self-efficacy self-esteem , measure respectively score General Self-Efficacy Scale ( GSES ) Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale ( RSES ) 0 week 8 week . Blinded assessor analyze outcome data intervention group , test whether change outcome measure would statistically comparable two group .
